author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chief Minister N. Rangasamy handed over 300 houses built by the Project Implementation Agency (PIA) with World Bank assistance to Tsunami affected families in Nallavadu village recently. The houses meant for fishermen living in Nallavadu village, which was affected in the 2004 tsunami have been constructed at a cost of Rs. 21 crore.

Built on the lines of a township on 6 hectares, the colony is self-sustaining in all major aspects. Each house has a built-up area of 364 square feet, a bedroom, hall, kitchen and toilet.

A 315 distribution transformer supplies power.

The township has been provided a sewerage treatment plant, an overhead water tank, sodium vapour lamps and an Anganwadi.

AIADMK MLA P. Purushothaman and officials from the PIA were present.
title: Rangasamy hands over 300 tsunami houses
